channel.title: Posts on Laure Zanna, Oxford
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Laure Zanna, Oxford

item.title: Paper on ocean dynamics & machine learning
item.description: The paper is available on the JAMES website

item.title: Some links to media articles for our PNAS paper
item.description:
You can find the paper and a summary in our publication list.

Our official press release can be found on the University of Oxford website.

A few examples of articles in the media that mentioned our work:

  • The Guardian

  • The Weather Channel

  • The New York Times

  • Phys.org

  • Science Daily

  • Forbes

  • Physics World

  • Physics Today

  • National Geographic

item.title: Upcoming Talks
item.description:
Wadham Symposium, Disruption, Oxford, Feb 2

Physical Society Club, London IOP, Feb 6

Physics and Mathematics of Turbulent Flows at Different Scales, Les Houches, Feb 24

Southampton, NOC seminar, Feb 27

Sources and Sinks of Ocean Mesoscale Eddy Energy, Florida, March 12-14

UK FAFMIP, Reading, April 3-5

EGU, Sea level: Past, Present, Future, Vienna, April 7-12

Orchestra Meeting, July 3-4

Equadiff, July 8-12

item.title: A New Team Member: Welcome to Emily Newsom
item.description: Emily is joining our group from Caltech as part of TICTOC.

item.title: Upgrading Climate Predictions With AI
item.description: A little story on our work on ocean and climate, including our new ideas using machine learning, published on the Wadham website

item.title: Ocean heat content 1871-2017
item.description: • Our new paper on reconstruction ocean heat content from 1871 to present was accepted in PNAS. The paper was part of our exciting NERC Large Grant TICTOC. Stay tuned for more info.

item.title: New Team Members
item.description:
Welcome of our newest team members:

  • Alex Todd will join as part of the project: Adressing the grand challenge of regional sea level prediction UK FAFMIP”, co-led with Jonathan Gregory

  • Mike Byrne will join us a Marie Curie Fellow working on monsoons dynamics under climate change.

item.title: TICTOC project meeting
item.description: The annual meeting of our project “Transient tracer-based Investigation of Circulation and Thermal Ocean Change” TICTOC will be held in Oxford on Sep 25-26

item.title: New papers on ocean ensembles and turbulence
item.description:
• Our new paper on “Uncertainty and Scale Interactions in Ocean Ensembles” was accepted in QJRMS

  • Congrats to Tomos David who just completed his PhD with us, and for his latest paper in J. of Stat Mech on eddy-mixing entropy in forced-dissipative geostrophic turbulence

item.title: US AMOC in Miami
item.description: Some of us will be attending the international US-AMOC meeting, I will talk about “AMOC in a changing climate: yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery”
